business.headline: Man flags extra charge on cash-on-delivery payments, Centre launches probeThe Department of Consumer Affairs has launched an investigation into e-commerce sites charging additional fees on cash-on-delivery payments.

Agents' body questions GST cut, says move undermines insurance distributionPrashant Mhatre, All India President of the General Insurance Agents Federation Integrated (GIAFI), has sounded an alarm, saying the decision risks weakening the role of agents, brokers, and advisors who are central to India's insurance reach.
Planning a personal loan? Don't make these 5 errorsWhile personal loans can be a handy financial tool, they come with risks if mismanaged. Avoid these five common errors to keep your finances safe.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs is a sorry tale of grease of doing business in IndiaChennai-based logistics company Wintrack has ceased Indian operations, alleging repeated bribery demands and harassment by Chennai Customs, exposing the ugly truth that at Indian Customs integrity is the real contraband.

Delhi government may revise circle rates, public feedback invitedThe Delhi government is considering a revision of circle rates across the city and has called on the public to share their views before any changes are finalised.

Health insurance in 2025: Key traps that could drain your pocketClauses such as room rent caps, deductibles, and co-pay options are often buried deep in policy documents but can have a massive influence on the claim process.
Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end higher fuelled by gains in metal stocksThe S&P BSE Sensex added 223.86 points to close at 81,207.17, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 57.95 points to end at 24,894.25.

63% of households aware, yet only 9.5% invest in markets, Sebi survey showsDespite growing awareness about investing in the markets, the latest Sebi survey shows that only a small fraction of households, i.e., just 9.5%, are actively investing.

Looking for high returns? This small savings scheme beats PPF and NSCMany investors assume PPF or NSC offer the best returns, but the scheme leads the pack with the highest interest among small savings schemes. Have a look.

Wintrack vs Chennai Customs: If forced to bribe, can companies fight legally?The Finance Ministry has already ordered an official probe, but the matter has also raised a wider debate: if businesses are forced to pay bribes to get their consignments cleared, do they have the law on their side?

Will Zerodha end its zero-brokerage model for equity delivery trades?Zerodha, long known for offering free equity delivery trades, could soon charge for delivery trades for the first time, signalling a major shift for investors.

India can't be passive spectator: Nirmala Sitharaman talks tough amid US tariffsUnion Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman opened the Kautilya Economic Conclave 2025 in New Delhi, urging India to play a more active role in shaping global decisions amid growing economic and geopolitical uncertainty.

entertainment.headline: Of Gods and ghosts: How mythology and folklore power India's cinematic universes Indian filmmakers are increasingly creating cinematic universes inspired by mythology and folklore, blending traditional stories with modern narratives. This trend is reshaping Indian cinema with ambitious projects spanning films, animation, and more.

Baahubali films off Netflix: On which platforms can you watch them in India? Baahubali and Baahubali 2 are currently not available on Netflix. However, fans can catch the epic films on five other platforms. Check it out.

BTS Jin concerts cause Incheon hotel prices to soar by 200 per cent Hotels near Incheon Munhak Main Stadium raise rates sharply ahead of BTS' Jin's encore concerts. Fans and non-fan guests report cancelled bookings and increased accommodation costs.

Arbaaz Khan, Sshura Khan arrive at hospital ahead of baby's birth: Reports Actor Arbaaz Khan and Sshura Khan arrived at PD Hinduja Hospital for the birth of their first child together, according to reports. Family members and friends attended a private baby shower before admission.

Genie, Make A Wish Review: Woo-bin, Suzy's chemistry casts a spell, almost!Release Date:Fri Oct 03, 2025 South Korean actors Kim Woo-bin and Suzy reunite in the new fantasy-romance K-drama 'Genie, Make a Wish'. The series explores temptation and morality with a unique blend of dark humour and fantasy.
Vijay Sethupathi hosts Bigg Boss Tamil Season 9: Read all about the show 'Bigg Boss Tamil' Season 9 will premiere on October 5. Vijay Sethupathi returns as host for the new season.

When is Rashmika Mandanna's The Girlfriend releasing? Check confirmed date here Makers of 'The Girlfriend', starring Rashmika Mandanna, confirmed the film's release date on Saturday, a day after reports of her engagement with Vijay Deverakonda went viral. The film also stars Dheekshith Shetty.

Samay Raina takes hilarious dig at Dhanashree, Yuzvendra in new ad with RJ Mahvish Comedian Samay Raina featured in a new ad with Yuzvendra Chahal's rumoured girlfriend, RJ Mahvish. In the commercial, Raina took a sly dig at Yuzvendra and his ex-wife Dhanashree Verma.

Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna engagement: A look at their timeline Actors Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda got engaged at a private ceremony in Hyderabad. The couple's relationship timeline has included years of speculation and subtle public hints.

Taylor Swift turns heartbreak into happily ever after from Glitch to Wi$h Li$t From 'Glitch' to 'Wi$h Li$t', Taylor Swift turns heartbreak into a fairytale in 'The Life of a Showgirl', marking her most romantic era yet.

Veteran actor Sandhya Shantaram dies at 94 Veteran actor Sandhya Shantaram has passed away at the age of 94. She was known for her roles in films like 'Jhanak Jhanak Payal Baaje', 'Do Aankhen Barah Haath', 'Navrang', and the Marathi film 'Pinjara'.

Karnataka State Awards: Rakshit Shetty, Archana Jois win big The Karnataka State Awards were announced recently, honouring the best talent for their contribution to cinema. Take a look at the complete list of winners.

Bigg Boss 19 ep 41: Amaal Mallik furious after physical fight with Abhishek Bajaj Amaal Mallik and Abhishek Bajaj got into a heated argument after Amaal referred to Ashnoor Kaur as Bhokti hai during her caretaker stint. The clash intensified with Amaal issuing aggressive threats and challenging the makers.

KBC 17: Amitabh Bachchan promises support to contestant's son with special needs Contestant Pooja Shah wins Rs 12,50,000 on 'Kaun Banega Crorepati' 17 for her son's future. Amitabh Bachchan promises to assist in finding better treatment options.

Kangana Ranaut praises PM Modi's style, calls him the perfect showstopper Actor Kangana Ranaut walked as the showstopper for Raabta by Rahul's bridal jewellery showcase in Delhi. She commended Prime Minister Modi's sense of style, highlighting his leadership and calling him the perfect showstopper.

Blake Lively shows support for Taylor Swift's new album amid rumours of rift Actor Blake Lively liked Taylor Swift's post about her new album amid reports of a strained friendship. Their relationship reportedly became strained after Lively's lawsuit involving Justin Baldoni.

Sunil Pal slams Aryan Khan's Netflix show for mocking Bollywood Aryan Khan's directorial debut 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' draws criticism from comedian Sunil Pal. He objects to Khan's critique of the industry that made his father, Shah Rukh Khan, a star.

I lost my self-respect: What Diddy said in tearful remarks before sentencing Rapper Sean 'Diddy' Combs, in his tearful remarks before the sentencing, apologised for his mistakes and said how he had lost self-respect.  He has been sentenced to 4 years and 2 months for arranging drug-fueled sexual encounters.

Steve review: Cillian Murphy shines in a raw tale of compassion and chaosRelease Date:Fri Oct 03, 2025 Steve review: Director Tim Mielants crafts a quietly devastating portrait of empathy and resilience in this raw drama, featuring Cillian Murphy as a headteacher holding on to hope while his world unravels. Is the Netflix drama worth your time? Here is our review.

general news.headline: Doctor arrested after 10 children die in Madhya Pradesh from toxic cough syrupThe police have arrested Dr Praveen Soni, who prescribed the cough syrup to children, and registered a case against him and Sresun Pharmaceuticals, Tamil Nadu-based manufacturer of the 'Coldrif' syrup.

Israel agreed to withdrawal line, Hamas confirmation would trigger ceasefire: TrumpTrump said that as soon as Hamas gives its confirmation, a ceasefire will be effective immediately, and a prisoner exchange will begin. He also urged Hamas to "move quickly" to accept his peace plan for war-torn Gaza.

Shutdown Blues in Washington, Ripples in New Delhi, MumbaiA prolonged government shutdown coupled with steep tariffs threatens to further sap American demand, unsettle capital flows, and further deepen pressures already weighing on India's exports, rupee and stock markets.

Hyderabad student, working at US gas station, shot deadAn Indian student from Hyderabad, who went to the US for his higher studies, was shot dead by miscreants in Texas. The incident reportedly occurred at a gas station where the victim worked on a part-time basis.
The Operation Sindoor 2.0 warningIndia's security establishment warns Field Marshal Asim Munir against adventurism.

Will the Asia Cup row overshadow the India-Pakistan Colombo blockbuster?Women's World Cup: India's group clash with Pakistan in Colombo goes beyond cricket, unfolding amid political tension and the lingering shadow of recent men's team controversies. While both camps are keen to keep politics out of the contest, India will look to extend their dominant record over their arch-rivals.

Hamas will be disarmed, easy or hard way: Netanyahu amid Gaza ceasefire talksIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said he hopes Israeli hostages in Gaza could be freed "in the coming days" under Trump's peace plan, while reaffirming Israel will maintain control and push Hamas disarmament.

Delhi baba's flirty online comments surface as molestation probe deepensPosts from self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyanand Saraswati's verified X (formerly Twitter) account reveal a pattern of inappropriate, flirtatious, and suggestive comments on photographs uploaded by women.

Pak blinks as it signs deal with POK protesters, calls it victory of peaceAfter several days of violent protests in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir, the Pakistani government wilted under pressure and signed a 25-point agreement with the protesters. The deal includes compensation, reforms and infrastructure commitments.

'Rigged' vote fury: Clashes as Georgia protesters try to storm presidential palaceRiot police clashed with protesters outside Georgia's presidential palace during municipal elections, using water cannons and tear gas as demonstrators accused the ruling Georgian Dream party of fraud and pro-Russian policies.

Hindu outfit objects to women in western attire at modelling show in RishikeshA modelling rehearsal in Rishikesh ahead of a Diwali fair sparked protests from a Hindu group objecting to women's western attire, leading to a heated confrontation.

Pak asks Trump to develop port on Arabian Sea, close to Iran's ChabaharAs per Pakistan's blueprint, the civilian port will be located in Pasni, a town in Balochistan's Gwadar district, placing it strategically close to the Chabahar port being developed by India in Iran.

Why Rohit Sharma was replaced as ODI captain well before 2027 World CupIndia's ODI captaincy baton has officially passed from Rohit Sharma to Shubman Gill, with selectors opting for long-term planning ahead of the 2027 World Cup. While Rohit and Virat Kohli remain in the squad, their futures now hinge on performance, fitness and commitment to domestic cricket.

Three states ban Coldrif cough syrup as tests confirm toxins amid child deathsMadhya Pradesh, Tamil Nadu and Kerala have banned the sale and distribution of Coldrif cough syrup after laboratory tests found the medicine to be "substandard and adulterated," containing 48.6% Diethylene Glycol, a toxic chemical that can cause severe harm or even death.

India my matrubhumi: Ex-Pak cricketer Danish Kaneria's big claim on citizenshipDanish Kaneria, a Hindu, rejected speculation that his recent positive remarks on India's internal affairs were driven by a motive to seek Indian citizenship.
How health-conscious Indians are powering the good food boomWith more and more households opting for healthier food as a lifestyle choice, the brands know which way the wind blows.

Will Vijay be arrested for Karur stampede? Tamil Nadu Minister respondsTamil Nadu Minister Durai Murugan has clarified that actor-politician Vijay will not be arrested in connection with the Karur stampede unless there is concrete evidence. The 41-death tragedy, which occurred during a TVK rally, is under investigation by a SIT led by IG Asra Garg.

Move quickly or else...: Trump's fresh warning to Hamas to accept Gaza peace planAsserting that he wouldn't tolerate "any delay", US President Donald Trump warned Hamas to cease fighting with Israel and lay down its arms or else "all bets will be off".

No one will play role of big brother this time: Bihar BJP's message ahead of pollsAddressing the media after a state election committee meeting, Jaiswal said, "This time, no one will play the role of big brother or small brother. The NDA will fight together, like a rock, with full unity and strength."

sports.headline: Health scare in Australia A camp as four players fall ill in Kanpur The Australia A team in Kanpur faced a health setback as four players, including their captain, were affected by stomach infections during the unofficial one-day series against India A.

INDW vs PAKW: Saba Karim names Pakistan cricketers who can challenge India Former wicketkeeper Saba Karim said India must prepare thoroughly for their Women's World Cup clash against Pakistan, keeping an eye on key players like Sidra Amin, Fatima Sana, and their spinners.

Estevao's late winner helps Chelsea sink Liverpool, United, Arsenal win Estevao was the star of the show as his late goal helped Chelsea secure a thrilling 2-1 win over Liverpool on Sunday, October 4. Arsenal moved to the top of the points table while Manchester United eased pressure off Ruben Amorim by beating Sunderland.

A day after being biten by dog, Kenyan coach says no measures still taken A day after being attacked and biten by a dog, Kenyan coach Dennis Maragia said that not enough measures have been taken at the venue of the World Para Athletics Championships in Delhi.

Irani Cup 2025: Vidarbha inches closer to third title as ROI left reeling Vidarbha are on the cusp of securing their third Irani Cup title as the Rest Of India were left reeling at the end of Day 4's play with the lose of two wickets. ROI have a steep mountain to climb if they want to win the title on the final day.

Never question Virat Kohli's fitness: Harbhajan Singh shuts down readiness doubts Harbhajan Singh slammed critics doubting Virat Kohli's fitness, calling him a "fitness guru" and the fittest player in international cricket. He backed Kohli to return strongly in ODIs, saying the star still has what it takes.

Leadership nothing new to Ravindra Jadeja: Always gave my inputs when needed Ravindra Jadeja said that vice-captaincy was never something new for him as he always kept himself as a leader in the team throughout his career. Jadeja was the star of the show as India thrashed West Indies in Ahmedabad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
